intro: Kosteletzkya diplocrater var. bathiei, commonly known as the Florida morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland restoration efforts.
